p:
R 2 rises as the number of descriptors increase. Hence R 2 does not assure the effectiveness of the equations. R 2 adj is used to reconfirm the strength and effectiveness of the equation.
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$ {\mathrm{R}}_{\mathrm{adj}}^2=\frac{R^2-P\left(n-1\right)}{n-p+1} $$\end{document}

− P
n − 1
n − p + 1
